description.value:
You have studied with a capable teacher, or at a college, perhaps learning lore, languages, or perhaps learning other skills through a mentor.

Options:

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SlpfN4upg7reMFI1]{Coder}

    You can ably create written ciphers. Others cannot decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it. Your spellbook, if you have one, may be written in such ciphers preventing it from being copied by anyone who you have not taught the cipher to.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4CgsuCTFheSOt2Gs]{Encouraging Performance}

    As you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can put on a performance using tools with which you have proficiency and give Heroic Inspiration to allies who witness the performance. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zWFLn8Jq7Z6hN35n]{Erudition}

    Whenever you roll a 20 on a D20 Test using your proficiency or expertise, you get a Heroic Inspiration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PM0r9mgBheJpmUBd]{Expert Education*}

    Gain expertise in a skill or tools for which you are proficient.

    Foundry Note

    Upon selecting this feat, you will have to manually grant yourself expertise on your character sheet. It is recommended that you edit this feat with the skill you selected for your own reference.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.RMSQpFabEtkn4Qbc]{Fast Crafting}

    When you finish a Long Rest, you can craft one piece of gear from the Fast Crafting table, provided you have the Artisan's Tools associated with that item. The item lasts until you finish another Long Rest, at which point the item falls apart. Additional items may be craftable at your DM's discretion.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.I0qiNuF3wceGVFkR]{Linguist*}

    You learn three languages of your choice. Your understanding of communication allows you to communicate with a creature who speaks a language you do not know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of interaction. In addition you may decipher a written language you do not know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of study.

    Foundry Note

    Upon selecting this feat, you will have to manually grant yourself the languages on your character sheet. It is recommended that you edit this feat with the languages you selected for your own reference.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dnOz7nNs6qABJiu4]{Skill Training*}

    Gain proficiency in a skill in which you are not proficient. This bullet may be selected more than once.

    Foundry Note

    Upon selecting this feat, you will have to manually grant yourself proficiency on your character sheet. It is recommended that you edit this feat with the skill you selected for your own reference.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pRTgrG8XTV0gU72F]{Studied}

    You gain Advantage on any intelligence ability check to recall information about a type of creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.OMUtgMZMx5xEiXvP]{Tool Training*}

    Gain proficiency in three sets of tools for which you are not proficient. You may add half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down) on any ability check to use a set of tools for which you are not proficient.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.twxrTknMBW644KkL]{Up to the Task}

    When you make an Ability Check in a skill you have proficiency or expertise in, you do so at Advantage.

    You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kFBj2MeRkv4kTXuC]{Up to the Task 2}

    When you make an Ability Check, you do so at Advantage.

    You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

    Foundry Note

    The limited uses for this feat are present on the first Up to the Task bullet, you do not get double uses.
